articles.title: Monkeypox cases drop 21% globally, reversing month-long increase: WHO - CBC News
articles.description: The number of monkeypox cases reported globally dropped by 21 per cent in the last week, reversing a month-long trend of rising infections and a possible signal the outbreak in Europe may be starting to decline, according to a new report from the World Health…
articles.content: The number of monkeypox cases reported globally dropped by 21 per cent in the last week, reversing a month-long trend of rising infections and a possible signal the outbreak in Europe may be starting… [+4845 chars]

articles.author: Clea Caulcutt
articles.title: Macron heads to Algeria amid strained ties with former colony - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: The French president will be watched for missteps on France’s colonial past during a high-stakes visit to Algeria.
articles.content: ALGIERS French President Emmanuel Macron will land in Algeria on Thursday his first visit to the former colony in five years aiming to improve tense relations with the gas-rich nation as the EU wrest… [+9036 chars]

articles.author: Steven Chase, Claudia Scholz
articles.title: Canada signs non-binding agreement with Germany to export hydrogen to Europe by 2025 - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: Canadian-German deal sets no targets for volumes of hydrogen produced and contains no commitments of new money to help commence exports by the target date
articles.content:
